function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Strategies related to the built environment have a higher environmental and economic impact, thus their environmental and economic sustainability is lower.","Impact":"Potential negative impact on the environment and economy due to strategies related to the built environment.","Mitigation":"Implementation of sustainable building practices, use of energy-efficient technologies, and adoption of green building standards.","Technologies":"Energy-efficient HVAC systems, green building materials, sustainable construction practices.","People":"Stakeholders involved in building design, construction, and management.","Owner":"Architects, engineers, developers, building owners, and facility managers."},{"Description":"Company policies are typically preventive measures, easier to implement, and likely to be adopted at early stages.","Impact":"Inadequate adoption of preventive measures may lead to increased risk of disease transmission in the workplace.","Mitigation":"Promotion of health and safety protocols, clear communication of policies, and regular training on preventive measures.","Technologies":"Health and safety awareness programs, digital communications platforms for policy dissemination, training and education materials.","People":"Employers, employees, and workplace safety committees.","Owner":"Employers, human resources departments, and safety managers."},{"Description":"Measures applied to the built environment are typically corrective and may be challenging to implement during an emergency.","Impact":"Inadequate implementation of corrective measures may lead to ineffective disease mitigation in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Development of emergency response plans, establishment of rapid deployment protocols, and stockpiling of emergency supplies.","Technologies":"Building automation systems, real-time monitoring technologies, emergency preparedness and response tools.","People":"Facility management teams, emergency responders, and public health authorities.","Owner":"Facility managers, emergency response coordinators, and building administrators."}]}
